title.narrative: 1.2. PREVENTION OF VIOLENCE

description.narrative: By 2021, there will have been improvements to prevention programmes and strategies for physical and sexual violence, particularly against female adolescents and girls, at school and in the family, in the priority territories., which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Child Protection And Emergencies, Child Protection â€“ Strengthen Families And Communities, Data And Child Protection, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect (Covid), Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, children and adolescents will be brought up and educated without violence and will access services that guarantee their protection and access to justice

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2021, there will have been improvements to prevention programmes and strategies for physical and sexual violence, particularlyagainst female adolescents and girls, at school and in the family, in the priority territories.

description.narrative: UNICEF facilitated;further advancement;of;school violence prevention agenda in Peru through the formal launch;of the;Positive;Discipline;Programme;;and;implementation of;its toolkit;aimed at development of socio-emotional skills at school and;at home thereby allowing public;primary and secondary;school principals;and teachers;to;have access to;instruments to;promote;harmonious school existence free from violence at school.;Under;national;Cuna Más;programme including its family accompanying;component;in rural areas reached;176,700;caregivers;through the technical teams trained by UNICEF to promote;positive;child rearing;and;detection;of violence;against children at home.;;;; | Status:Met | As-of Date:17/12/2021

title.narrative: Number of social programs to support families and children who have incorporated validated strategies that promote non-violent parenting practices.(48393)

target.value: 2021:At least 1 program in level 5 (Implementation of strategy is on course) and 1 in level 4 (There is a formally approved strategy)

actual.value: 2021:Out of two socialprogrammes,PNCM: Family care service achieved level 5 andMoESocio-emotional strategy with families achieved level 4.

Level of implementation of validated strategies of prevention and response to physical, sexual and gender-based violence in the educational establishments of the prioritized areas, developed by the education sector.(48394)

baseline.value: There is a national strategy on school violence centered on peer violence, which does not address adult physical and sexual violence against children and adolescents.

target.value: 2021:At least 1 strategy in level 4 (Implementation in prioritized regions)
